comments:
I followed the instructions in the documentation for setting up a project that uses source from another 
one, where I added the source tree from the other project so if I made changes to that code, it would 
automatically be compiled into WEB-INF/classes. When I would try and save a file that, I would get an 
error about a rule violation and the save would fail. I had to go back to having separate projects and 
doing compilation through Ant. This message was in the logs:

The JarUtilities class is attempting to play nicely with the resources layer by
scheduling exclusive access to some JARs.  Unfortunately, when its use is
triggered by a resource modification, the scheduling rule for the JARs is larger
than the rule for the file being saved.
Removing the scheduling code; it's bypassing the workspace resource layer anyway.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.

Marking as verified as I know this issue is fixed (or correctly categorized).
If, as originator, you disagree or still see, please re-open, or open a new bug. 

Thanks very much for reporting and helping make WTP better.
